senses.de: The people who work for an organization or company
senses.ex: The company is reducing its personnel due to budget cuts

Tips.title: Company Size
Tips.description: Large companies usually have more personnel than small businesses.
Tips.example: The multinational corporation has a personnel of over 10,000 employees.

Tips.title: Workforce Diversity
Tips.description: Personnel can refer to a diverse set of employees with different roles and skills.
Tips.example: Our personnel include engineers, designers, and salespeople.

Tips.title: Non-human Resources
Tips.description: Only use 'personnel' for people, not machines or other resources.
Tips.example: The new software isn't part of the personnel; it's a tool they use.

senses.de: A department in a company responsible for hiring, training and taking care of employees
senses.ex: She works in personnel at a large manufacturing firm

Tips.title: Beyond Hiring
Tips.description: The personnel department deals with more than just hiring; it handles employee benefits and issues too.
Tips.example: I'm going to the personnel department to discuss my health benefits.

Tips.title: Employee Relations
Tips.description: Use 'personnel' to discuss relationships and interactions within the workforce.
Tips.example: Personnel disputes are resolved through our mediation process.

Tips.title: Formality Level
Tips.description: The term 'personnel' is more formal than 'staff' and often used in writing.
Tips.example: The annual report contains a section on personnel achievements.

Crew.wordDefinition:
Crew typically refers to a group of people who work together on a vehicle or vessel, such as a ship or an airplane. For example, the crew of a ship includes the captain, sailors, and other workers responsible for operating the ship.

Crew refers specifically to a group of workers who operate a vehicle or vessel, while personnel can refer to any group of workers who work together for a common purpose.

Employee.wordDefinition:
Employee refers to an individual who is hired by a company or organization to perform a specific job or set of tasks in exchange for payment.

Personnel refers to the entire workforce or staff of an organization, including employees, managers, and executives.

In practical terms, employee is used to refer to an individual worker within the context of their job, such as when discussing job duties, salaries, or benefits.

For example, a company might have a personnel department that is responsible for managing the entire workforce, including hiring, training, and retaining employees.

Employee refers to an individual worker, while personnel refers to the entire workforce of an organization.

Force.wordDefinition:
Force refers to a group of people organized and equipped for a particular purpose, such as an army, police force, or a football team.

Personnel specifically refers to the people employed by an organization or business. Force is applicable in situations that require a group of people to achieve a goal, while personnel is applicable in situations that require the people working for an organization to be identified or managed.

For example, a military force might be sent to respond to a crisis, while a business might hire new personnel to fill a position.

Manpower.wordDefinition:
Manpower refers to the number of people who are available and able to do a job, especially in a particular work environment or organization.

Manpower refers to the available workforce for a particular task, while personnel refers to the actual people employed within a specific organization or business.

Staff.wordDefinition:
Staff typically refers to a specific group of people within that organization who are responsible for particular tasks or functions.

For example, a restaurant might have a waitstaff, kitchen staff, and management staff.

Personnel is a broader term that encompasses all employees, while staff describes a specific group of employees who work together towards a particular goal or function.

Team.wordDefinition:
Team refers to a group of people who work together towards a common goal or objective.

A team is usually made up of individuals with complementary skills who collaborate to achieve a specific task or project.

The focus of a team is on achieving a collective outcome, whereas personnel refers to individuals within an organization.

Applicability of each word may differ and it depends on the context. Personnel is more commonly used in the human resources department of a company, while the word team is more often used in a sports context, or when working on a specific project where teamwork is involved.

quotes.Text: Are there things you can do with the rest of your personnel or are things you can do schematically to help a quarterback? I think so. But at the end of the day, that quarterback still has to be a driving force of your team, especially if you want to be a consistent winner over time.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Paul DePodesta

quotes.Text: When I gave birth to my fourth child, I suffered from post partum hemorrhaging. I almost lost my life. I was lucky to be under the care of trained health care personnel. I started wondering then what was happening to women in rural villages.
quotes.Title: Politician
quotes.Name: Joyce Banda

quotes.Text: It is clear that a temporary increase in the cap is needed to ensure high-tech companies can hire the specialized personnel they need to continue to help fuel California's economic growth.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Pete Wilson

quotes.Text: When police or security personnel work in schools, they should follow the community policing model that integrates officers into school life, not just involve them when trouble arises.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Randi Weingarten

quotes.Text: When you have to work with and exist amongst cynical, burned-out personnel on a set, it doesn't matter what you're shooting or how much you're being paid - it's not worth it.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Henry Rollins

quotes.Text: Through partnerships and the use of technology, there is an opportunity to help veterans and transitioning military personnel find new career and educational opportunities.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Tae Yoo

quotes.Text: Outstanding leaders go out of their way to boost the self-esteem of their personnel. If people believe in themselves, it's amazing what they can accomplish.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Sam Walton

quotes.Text: You need the management personnel who can help you out with various things. The captain can't be asked to get into every decision.
quotes.Title: Pakistani Athlete
quotes.Name: Shahid Afridi

quotes.Text: It's appalling how much money raised at some charity events gets wasted on paying personnel and admin staff.
quotes.Title: Irish Designer
quotes.Name: Jasmine Guinness

quotes.Text: We have the finest military personnel in the world.
quotes.Title: British Politician
quotes.Name: Theresa May
